caption.p:
( A) Schematic of the agent-based model simulating intracellular viral replication and spread by cell-free (CF) and cell-to-cell (CC) transmission among stationary cells. Cells are assumed to be hexagonally shaped and can be either uninfected (gray) or infected (red). The parameters
p c
and
p f
define the probability of infection by CC- and CF-transmission, respectively, dependent on the intra- and extra-cellular viral load at the corresponding grid sites; ( B) Simulated time courses of intracellular viral load (black line) and produced extracellular virus (gray line) for one infected cell; ( C) Realization of simulation outcomes after around three days post infection assuming simultaneous occurrence of CF- and CC-transmission (left) or only CC-transmission (right). Cells infected by CF or CC-transmission are indicated in blue and orange, respectively.
